title: Early Language and Literacy
subject: Infant and Toddler Early Learning and Development Standards (2024-)

document.title: Infant and Toddler Maine Early Learning and Development Standards (Infant Toddler MELDS)

8CA520988214489C8804787F69B158A7.description:
begins to make observations about
the use of words and pictures

7C5876A48ED7489992D8F011430A85C9.description:
Shows increased attention when being
read to:

4FD9D1E27AF445B995A34330E1DAE1B8.description:
tells others what own scribbles
mean

00AD79D580E143B79370E9C63507D0C0.description:
converses with others using play
phone

DA857F3045174BEC913C3AEAB4E44940.description:
Recognizes signs and symbols in the
environment: identifies stop sign, labels
or logos of familiar places/items;
memorizes and repeats phrases of
songs, books, rhymes.

6F3744DC01B94D758F1E44325544CDA9.description: turns pages at the right time

5F68663C42AF4C25B96A714B604C98CD.description:
makes sounds that relate to
pictures

E9F292D8BD0343B7817DE2DF47E1D1C4.description:
looks at books, magazines as if
reading

92E5AE00639441898E865EDCA7368852.description:
Exhibits increased participation with
written forms of communication:

06830C5D55DD4C3F831A1D337745BA90.description:
Begins to “use” communication tools
during imitative play:

C3666ABC491C43C38091ACBC89928461.description:
Makes motions for familiar games,
rhymes, songs or finger plays.

6499F6C986E548A999F841120DB4A05A.description:
Exhibits increased participation when
books are read:

7D8A850326D1490699E2C106155EBCC2.description:
Uses signs or gestures in response to
adult’s conversation with them about
photos of familiar people.

AC5FB07EBCCD43719543854F372EC2DF.description:
Listens and attends to repetitions of
culturally and linguistically familiar
words, songs or rhymes.

44FE3537D70048A7BE74E8AFC9F3DC6D.description:
Kicks feet or moves arms in response to
music.

001F86E319AB42C2B5689A9346F418E8.description:
Looks at books, pats the pictures, brings
book to mouth.

0483D6B58FD4429FB6C0F706B87742C8.description:
With a responsive adult, looks at and
attends to pictures of other babies or
faces.

22AF41FFA9F148429A08F4B14D523194.description:
Carries on sustained interactions with
caregivers.

33979BD0A96341348947AD9B193B5884.description:
Vocabulary increases with age;
articulation becomes increasingly
clearer; may express feelings both
physical and emotional.

CBCE9A7239BF4D5784E5E2100126F6CD.description:
Refers to self by name; uses personal
pronouns (I, me, you) with increased
proficiency.

A6852FD9B14045839AFFF2F9A6D84A18.description:
uses language to convey simple
ideas

D0FE68C79DC145C3BFBFB9ADEF0917B7.description: talks about what they are doing

D81B639B714147F8A89F49D2F842DA3E.description:
Uses everyday experiences to build on
vocabulary:

FCBA50C85275473193F21A3B5242D708.description:
Asks and answers simple questions: lots
of what, why and where questions.

5F7CC1EC93FF48188046522DD2DD3C94.description:
Combines words into simple sentences:
“Mommy bye-bye”, “Milk all gone”.

9E693B75FF9B4D08AA83555A4AA42127.description:
may use words to solve conflicts with
peers/siblings

6CF5E95DFBB4411ABF81E6860C03CF17.description:
Uses words or actions to request
assistance:

D8CB8944705647DBBF0B07C0A3FF3E31.description:
Moves toward expression of identifiable
words:

7F7F5235DD58435A8DD6614B923CD645.description:
Takes turns in back-and-forth verbal
play with caregiver that mimics a
conversation. Responds to caregiver’s
speech by babbling/uttering in reply.

386C4E35EA58483498D604B3692A3C3B.description:
Expresses self with movement or facial
expressions: shakes head “no”; nods
“yes”; smiles; frowns.

7EA88BCFAB764556BACF857E6DBC2031.description:
expresses own needs such as hunger
or wanting comfort item

3EFB933F1CEF4E89AC29FC8A3C27D15D.description:
moves, points or motions to object
out of reach

900F684D607D4A328383F431054D4120.description:
gazes between adult and desired
item,

C24F10874958492180378E2A751BD29B.description:
Uses physical gestures or sounds to get
help from adult:

390528F8074140E291D36A68BB5CE445.description:
Makes a variety of repetitive sounds
or gestures: babbles and coos; pairs
consonants and vowels with repetition
such as “ma” or “da”; uses hands to
express self.

0CEF33B582BD422BAD6DC52C5B85AF18.description:
moves body in anticipation of being
picked up

8B1F53E662FB415A94C747F841D13241.description:
smiles or gestures to initiate social
contact

8293BCE18B6B45959961CBCA5DCD03CF.description:
cries, grunts or makes loud sounds to
seek caregiver assistance

BE1911FE1DFA47E284AEDD29404AEA73.description:
Initiates communication with caregiver:
maintains eye contact:

EE50DCD2924E4B42827FF11AA5588F90.description:
Shows increased attention span when
being read to, listening to rhymes, finger
plays, songs of increased complexity.

D09B17C01EC44E189D1F54659A920A63.description:
With adult direction, finds items needed
for an activity.

196B615978944B129245723C346FE9BD.description:
yes/no, come/go, run/stop, up/
down, fast/slow

130ED53DD1ED470CBB662686F3237CCA.description:
Understands names for common
objects, familiar people, familiar actions.

D9A9DA64E566491E97513151F17D71F1.description:
Understands a variety of simple two-step
requests and follows multi-step daily
routines like handwashing.

F70806556E844877816C22850D5A1D88.description:
Attends to and enjoys listening to adult
voices: rhymes, songs, short stories,
imitation games such as pat-a-cake.

15F60CB61AE246A4A1C58AA08623C99B.description:
Looks to adult for messages about
appropriate or inappropriate behavior.

1A4AA0638BC04834A51E856FEABC4968.description:
Understands simple one step requests
such as “Get your blanket”, “Give me your
cup”.

DFADA839924D4EA9AE7FEF50822A2FA6.description:
points or reaches to familiar objects
when named as in body parts,
favorite toys, family pictures

860ECD7CA52B40B5A2A3467D9B006E26.description:
turns to look at familiar person/
object/pet when named

CCEBD0DF23C047B6A8551D2205A1D93F.description:
Responds with gestures or vocal signals
to familiar words:

5D3E38A38C724BED931A984887B5FED7.description:
startles or cries at loud sounds, shows
different responses to tones of voice,
looks for source of sounds

EEA955D6211B4B8A815134591BAA9688.description:
Reacts to new voices or sounds by
becoming more quiet or active:

F608F0C21A7D49D8A64D19864E498D99.description:
appears to watch or listen, quiets self,
turns toward conversation

E14E510CD0BF4F499B89D2B37388FF15.description:
mutually gazes with primary
caregivers, shows preference for
voice of primary caregivers

1CA6513BD3C04BCFBF4920C7F84B1998.description:
Maintains eye contact with person
looking at him or her:
